isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 7: VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - CRANKCASE (RECONDITIONING) - CRANKSHAFT AND MAIN BEARINGS

step1.para: Rotate engine so the main bearing saddles are facing upward. Wipe main bearing saddle using a lint-free cloth. The supports must be free of oil. DO NOT LUBRICATE THE BACK SIDE OF THE BEARING INSERTS.

Install upper bearing inserts into bearing saddle. Be sure the locking tangs on the bearings are snapped into the crankcase ( Figure 7.79
).
Apply Prussian Blue(r) to the crankshaft main bearing journals. Carefully lower the crankshaft onto the main bearing inserts in the crankcase.

note.para: Do not install the main bearing caps and lower bearing inserts at this time.

step1.para: Carefully remove the crankshaft and inspect the upper bearing inserts for an even transfer of bluing from the journals to the bearings.

note.para: IF VOIDS APPEARED IN THE BLUING TRANSFER, THE CRANKCASE INTEGRITY IS QUESTIONABLE.

step1.para: When satisfied that crankcase is in good order and free of distortion and burrs around upper bearing insert seats, clean all Prussian Blue(r) from the bearings and crankshaft journals.
